alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued February 06 at 7:29AM AKST until February 06 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 65 below zero. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast near Point Lay. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and coldest wind chills are near Point Lay. Wind chills are 40 to 50 below in other areas. Winds at Point Lay are expected to decrease this afternoon and wind chills will become less severe then.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create dangerously low wind chill values. Frost bite can occur quickly and even hypothermia or death if precautions are not taken.
